## 1. Summary:
The chat primarily focused on sharing and distributing Hyperfy applications (.hyp files). Gert-Jan Akerboom created a UI toggle button that allows world creators to add up to 14 links for visitors to download .hyp apps directly from worlds. Several methods for sharing .hyp files were discussed, including using the `world.open()` function with a URL parameter to enable downloads. ~/drdoge.eth mentioned optimizing a day/night/weather system with skybox transitions at sunrise/sunset. There were references to upcoming features like "the platform" being developed by Ash and the "black ops team." Lastraum shared updates about Forge hyperfy world setup for managing VRMs and data from inside Hyperfy. HiroP discovered that Hyperfy was indexed on deepwiki, making it easier to use with LLMs for app development. Community members also coordinated promotion for an upcoming proxim8/project89 party event.

## 2. FAQ:
Q: What would be the best place to store .hyp files so they can be downloaded in-world? (asked by Gert-Jan Akerboom) A: You could contribute to awesome-hyps GitHub repo, upload to hyperworld host, or wait for "the platform" coming soon (answered by ·≤º~/^b0gie-(.*)$/)
Q: How can I enable downloads of .hyp files from my world? (asked by Gert-Jan Akerboom) A: You can call world.open('https://somedomain.com/myapp.hyp', true) from a script (answered by Ashxn)
Q: What is "the platform"? (asked by Lastraum) A: Ash and the "black ops team" are developing it, mentioned in builder calls about 2 weeks ago (answered by ·≤º~/^b0gie-(.*)$/)
